question: A series LCR circuit containing an AC source of 100V has an inductor and a capacitor of reactances 24Ω and 16Ω respectively. If a resistance of 6Ω is connected in series, then the potential difference across the series combination of inductor and capacitor only is
explanation: Voltage across L and C combination = I * (X_L - X_C) = 10 * (24 - 16) = 80 V.
